intro: Guettarda lindeniana var. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a distinctive reticulate venation pattern, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
